newsitem.title: ITALY: Olivetti opening price set 3.86 pct down.
newsitem.headline: Olivetti opening price set 3.86 pct down.

text.p: The opening price of shares in troubled information technology group Olivetti was fixed 3.86 percent down at 580 lire (38 cents) in pre-bourse trade in Milan.
Olivetti, whose shares went limit down several times in Milan on Monday and fell around 20 percent, has a trading floor of 543 lire, 10 percent below Monday's closing price of 603.3 lire.

Olivetti shares were suspended for two days at the end of last week as Milan bourse watchdog Consob awaited a statement from the group on its half year accounts, after it announced a 440.2 billion lire pre-tax loss for the first half of 1996.
Consob said late on Monday Olivetti had 24 hours to answer seven questions on its 1996 accounts, but gave no indication what the questions were.

Consob officials carried out a preliminary examination of Olivetti's six-month figures on Monday morning and intend to call in Olivetti managers this week and consult the group's auditors next week. ($ = 1511 Italian Lire)
